Page._content:
Kenneth Cummins

kenneth.cummins@gmail.com  | (319)389-0990 | www.linkedin.com/in/kenneth-cummins  | Cedar Rapids, IA

Application Engineer/Systems Analyst

Multi-talented developer with over 8  years experience building HTML/CSS front ends, Ajax based dynamic content, PHP web services, J2EE components, SOAP based web clients, and stand-alone tools in Perl, shell scripts, and C.  Experienced system administrator with a focus on telecommunications, trouble ticketing, identity management, and database support, including importing and maintaining complex RDBMS data used for asset and network tracking, billing, and auditing. Core competencies include:

Linux and Windows configuration and support | PHP | Java/J2EE | WildFly/JBoss | HTML/CSS | Javascript | SQL/MySQL | Apache HTTP server installation and configuration | SOAP/SoapUI | LDAP | Role-based access control | GIT source control | JIRA project and ticket management | Perl | FLOSS installation and configuration | Asterisk/AGI server management | sh/bash scripting | Ant scripting

Professional Experience

READY WIRELESS, Hiawatha, IA                                                                 04/2012 – 4/2017

Software Engineer

High performing developer supporting and enhancing legacy systems as well as developing a new, enterprise-class platform to support an industry-leading MVNO/MVNE, including white-label clients. Provided effective interface between other IT staff and vendors during problem resolution. Leveraged industry standard protocols to integrate not only third party systems, but new internal platform. Provided timely and effective support for users and management through code releases and data manipulation.

  • Integrated USPS/Endicia and FedEx interfaces into a unified shipping module for new Enterprise platform.
  • Developed printing solution to slash support issues for provisioning and reverse logistics.
  • Provided root-cause analysis to allow senior developers to quickly target problem code.
  • Managed projects and incidents via JIRA and Bit Bucket

UNIV. OF IOWA HOSPITALS AND CLINICS , Iowa City, IA                                 04/2010 – 02/2012

Application Developer

Provided essential call data for internal and patient billing using MySoft by CompCo. Utilized a variety of tools to import and maintain necessary data. Maintained MS SQL databases. Enhanced and extended PostgreSQL and Apache servers on Linux to support RT ticketing system.

  • Customized RT to better match business practices and provide additional functionality.
  • Integrated RT with AD/LDAP to provide automatic user creation and single logon functionality.
  • Researched and documented major updates to RT and MySoft.
  • Part of the team defining business needs and evaluating products to potentially replace MySoft.

LEEPFROG TECHNOLOGIES , Iowa City, IA                                                 08/2008 – 11/2009

Web Developer

Part of an energized team working with a proprietary server-side Javascript engine to provide eCommerce and educational marketing solutions nationwide. Worked independently to diagnose problems and refactor code to mitigate issues and prevent future outages. Managed MySQL and MS SQL server installations, including data exchanges with 3rd parties. Helped ensure PCI compliance for payment gateway solution.

  • Developed shopping cart and order management portions of a new eCommerce site using HTML/CSS , and  Javascript (jquery)
  • Developed payment gateway, and fulfillment components using Javascript (server-side) and Coldfusion (Coldspring, Transfer)

THE WALT DISNEY COMPANY , Burbank, CA                                                 04/2005 – 02/2008

Identity Management Architect

Developed and documented Enterprise architecture for Identity lifecycle including provisioning and access control. Worked closely with Security developing PKI/certificate-based authentication and authorization systems. Provided third-tier support for CA Siteminder. Worked closely with application developers to ensure policy adherence for security. Developed new policies and procedures to secure new remote access systems. Developed tools to manage LDAP users and maintain CRL publication. Worked with vendors to develop proof of concept builds and potential architectures for new technology (Radiant Logic, Passlogix, Ping Identity, CA, etc.) Maintained Enterprise documentation for Identity Management domain, including best practices, use cases, and policies.

  • Architected and deployed two-factor gating for Citrix metaframe servers, including IIS configuration.
  • Configured and deployed Apache HTTP on Linux and Solaris servers as reverse proxies for SAP, JBoss, etc.

THE WALT DISNEY COMPANY , Burbank, CA                                                 09/2001 – 04/2005

Senior Systems Specialist

Configured, managed and maintained enterprise services based on iPlanet LDAP directories, CA SiteMinder including integration with Microsoft Active Directory, Jboss/Linux application servers and desktop clients. Primary contact for Siteminder and IdentityMinder configuration and support. Managed upgrades of SiteMinder and installation of IdentityMinder.

WALT DISNEY INTERNET GROUP , N. Hollywood, CA                                          07/2000 – 08/2001

IS Manager II

Managed Intranet servers running Apache on a Linux platform. Managed System Administrators and Desktop Support/Help Desk group for the North Hollywood offices. Assisted in the development of a Remedy based trouble ticket system. Architected email migration from Syntegra Mail*Hub to MS Exchange. Maintained X.500 directory, including directory synchronization with Exchange environment and directory replication with Corporate Messaging group.   Developed various reporting and maintenance tools in Perl and shell scripts. Provided 24/7 support for email system, as well as secondary support for Linux, Solaris and Windows servers globally.

WALT DISNEY INTERNET GROUP , New York, NY                                          02/1999 – 07/2000

System Administrator III

Managed Desktop Support team and provided server support for the Family.com offices. Administrated Linux, Sun, and NT servers, including Veritas, Networker, Exchange 5.5, and Samba. Supported TCP/IP network, including PPTP servers, routers and switches. Supported Syntegra Intrastore 2000/Mail*Hub email system .  Provided remote support for offices in Chicago, North Hampton, and London.

Professional Certifications

CompTIA Security+                                                                                          07/2008

Microsoft MCSA                                                                                         09/2008

Education

University of New Orleans, New Orleans, LA

Bachelor of Science – Computer Scienc e                                                                  08/1998

Post.title: KSP Controller
Post._content:
So I decided to start putting my Arduino to good (?) use. I've gotten some LEDs, an LCD panel, and a number of switches and buttons. So far, I have KSPSerialIO talking to my Arduino, and lighting up the basic indicators (main alarm, SAS, RCS, brakes, gear, lights, abort, and connection), and I'm trying to get my LCD screen to display the apoapsis and periapsis, but something is amiss in how I'm converting the float all the way to a string.

{% asset_img 0811150222.jpg %}
Post.raw:
title: KSP Controller
date: 2015-08-11 15:30:31
tags:
- KSP
categories:
- Hobby
- Video Gaming
---

Post.title: New site building tool
Post._content:
Getting the feel for Hexo, the tool I'm now using to build my site. I decided that as easy as using github's Jekyll was, I like the more substantial control I have using local tools. I even set up a branch just for the source, so I still have everything in github.

This doesn't mean I'm going to suddenly start posting more, just a change.
Post.raw:
title: "New site building tool"
date: 2015-03-22 19:07:25
tags:
---
Getting the feel for Hexo, the tool I'm now using to build my site. I decided that as easy as using github's Jekyll was, I like the more substantial control I have using local tools. I even set up a branch just for the source, so I still have everything in github.

This doesn't mean I'm going to suddenly start posting more, just a change.

tags:

Amazon said it was on time to be delivered May 30th. Came today! Thank you, Japan Post, USPS, and even US customs (for not holding it in NY).

Going to wait till tonight to start working on it. I think...

Post.title: Testing the Waters
Post.raw:
title: "Testing the Waters"
date: 2015-04-08 01:56:36
tags:
- Gundam_0079
categories:
- Hobby
- Gunpla
---
After seeing posts by several people in my Google+ circles, I finally decided to dip my toes into the potentially devastating hobby subculture of Gunpla. Based on helpful posts and some personal research (and an eye on my wallet), I decided to start with the 1/144 scale HGUC (High Grade Universal Century) models. It seems to bring together many of the recent innovations in design and production, but in a manageable size (and cost).

I'd love to be able to afford the Master Grade or Perfect Grade models, but they are much too large and too expensive for my budget and skill level. Maybe I'll treat myself someday.

Anyway, I decided to get *two* models. After watching a few of the original series, I decided to go with Amuro's RX-78-2 Gundam Mobile Suit and Char's MS-06S Zaku II Suit.

{% asset_img rx782144hguc.jpg %}

{% asset_img ms06sZaku2144.jpg %}
Post.content:
After seeing posts by several people in my Google+ circles, I finally decided to dip my toes into the potentially devastating hobby subculture of Gunpla. Based on helpful posts and some personal research (and an eye on my wallet), I decided to start with the 1/144 scale HGUC (High Grade Universal Century) models. It seems to bring together many of the recent innovations in design and production, but in a manageable size (and cost).

I’d love to be able to afford the Master Grade or Perfect Grade models, but they are much too large and too expensive for my budget and skill level. Maybe I’ll treat myself someday.

Anyway, I decided to get two models. After watching a few of the original series, I decided to go with Amuro’s RX-78-2 Gundam Mobile Suit and Char’s MS-06S Zaku II Suit.
Post.more:
After seeing posts by several people in my Google+ circles, I finally decided to dip my toes into the potentially devastating hobby subculture of Gunpla. Based on helpful posts and some personal research (and an eye on my wallet), I decided to start with the 1/144 scale HGUC (High Grade Universal Century) models. It seems to bring together many of the recent innovations in design and production, but in a manageable size (and cost).

I’d love to be able to afford the Master Grade or Perfect Grade models, but they are much too large and too expensive for my budget and skill level. Maybe I’ll treat myself someday.

Anyway, I decided to get two models. After watching a few of the original series, I decided to go with Amuro’s RX-78-2 Gundam Mobile Suit and Char’s MS-06S Zaku II Suit.

Post.title: The Academy
Post._content:
# Nintoq's Teaching Table

It began simply enough. Nintoq wanted to know more, and didn't believe his own master was being wholly forthcoming. So he made contact with a number of other apprentice wizards, and they began to gather in one of the private rooms of _The Grumpy Strumpet_, a dubious inn and flophouse just on the other side of the city walls from the freeport docks. A favorite of smugglers, privateers, and any other seafarers who want to avoid the cost and scrutiny of the city harbormaster, The Grumpy Strumpet is often a chaotic environment that is easy to blend into. And this is what Nintoq and his cabal did, sharing the secrets and knowledge of their masters in hopes of surpassing and supplanting them.
